action: Scroll 'Scroll down to see complete signup form'
observation: I can see a sign-up page with a form containing email and password input fields. There are also some buttons visible including 'Create Account' and 'Get Started' at the top of the visible area, and form fields below. I need to scroll down to see the complete form and fill it out.
reasoning: As a normal user wanting to sign up, I need to see the complete form first. The email and password fields are visible but seem to be cut off at the bottom. I should scroll down to see the full form layout before starting to fill it out.
ux_issues: Form fields appear to be positioned very far down on the page, requiring scrolling to access

outcome.visual_observation: The scroll action removed visible form elements (yellow and blue dashed border sections) and colored indicators (numbers 10 and 8 at bottom) without revealing any signup form content. The page appears to have scrolled past the form rather than revealing it.
outcome.diagnosis: The scroll action scrolled too far down, moving past the signup form elements instead of revealing the complete form. The form sections that were partially visible are now out of view.

evidence.actual_outcome: Scroll 'Scroll down to see complete signup form'
